resources.string: The app will take you to the following website:
Web addresses read through the app will be automatically accessed \n(Not recommended in terms of security)
Web addresses read through the app will have to be accepted before being accessed \n(Recommended setting)
The camera couldn\'t be opened. Please check if any other app is using the camera and try again.
All your history will be deleted
The code you just read isn\'t compatible with the app as it doesn\'t point to a website
OharEleanitzak is the app used for the visualisation of multilingual content using QR codes. If you need help with any of the features tap on the corresponding icon below:
Help associated with the QR reader
Help associated with the settings of the app
Help associated with the history of the app

string.name: qrLaguntzaTestua
string.p: In order to access the content of the museum from your mobile phone you need to scan a QR code. A QR code looks like this:

string.name: qrLaguntzaTestuaJarraipena
string.p: In order to scan the code you need to focus it in the images shown in the screen. Once the app has scanned the code, its content will be checked to see if it contains a url and if that\'s so, there will be two different ways to proceed: \n\n

ul.li: If the setting \'Accept redirection automatically\' is enabled the url will be directly accessed in a browser \n \n
If the setting \'Accept redirection automatically\' is disabled the user will have to authorize the url to be accessed

string.name: ezarpenakLaguntzaTestua
string.p: There are two different actions that can be performed in the \'Settings\' screen: \n\n

ul.li: \'Accept redirection automatically\': This setting specifies whether codes read with the scanner will be accessed straightaway or will require authorisation from the user. The recommendation is for this setting to be disabled for security enhancement \n\n
\'Language\': This setting will set the language of the app, which will have a direct impact on the language of the content accessed through the QR codes of OharEleanitzak

string.name: historiaLaguntzaTestua
string.p: The screen \'History\' can be used for managing the history of the app. You will be able to access previously read codes without re-reading them, besides deleting current history by using the option in the options menu

resources.string: There is no help associated with this topic
This image is used to show how a QR code looks like

An error has occurred while setting the language for the content of the QR code. Please, try again
